description:
## Grid Bundle Registration

Register a complete grid configuration (horizontal + vertical).

**This issue creates 5-6 entities automatically:**
- Horizontal grid cells (1-2 based on staggering)
- Horizontal subgrids (1-2 based on staggering)
- Horizontal computational grid (1)
- Vertical computational grid (1)

**Result:** Grid IDs (e.g., c100 and v100) to use when registering Model Components.

**Tip:** Check if similar grids exist before creating new ones!
## Grid Purpose

label: Purpose Description
description:
What is this grid configuration for?

Include component type and key characteristics.

placeholder: e.g., Ocean grid using ORCA1 tripolar configuration with 75 vertical levels

description: ## Horizontal Grid Configuration

label: Staggering Arrangement
description:
Grid staggering arrangement.

Defines positions of mass vs velocity variables.

Common:
- **arakawa-c**: Atmosphere/ocean (velocity at edges)
- **unstaggered**: Simple grids
- **tripolar**: Ocean grids

label: Primary Grid Type
description:
Main grid structure.

Most common:
- **regular-latitude-longitude**: Standard lat-lon
- **reduced-gaussian**: Gaussian
- **tripolar**: Ocean
- **cubed-sphere**: High-res atmosphere

label: Coordinate System
description:
Coordinate reference system.

Most common:
- **latitude-longitude**: Standard spherical
- **rotated-latitude-longitude**: Rotated pole

label: Region
description: Geographic coverage.\n\nSelect all that apply.

label: X Resolution
description:
Typical cell size in X direction.

For lat-lon: degrees longitude
For projected: kilometers

Omit if varies >25%.

label: Y Resolution
description:
Typical cell size in Y direction.

For lat-lon: degrees latitude
For projected: kilometers

Omit if varies >25%.

label: Resolution Units
description: Units for resolution values.\n\nRequired if resolution provided.

label: Total Cells
description: Approximate total number of horizontal cells.\n\nLeave blank if unknown or variable.
## Vertical Grid Configuration\n\nLeave all vertical fields blank if component has no vertical grid (e.g., 2D surface models).

label: Vertical Coordinate Type
description:
Coordinate system for vertical.

Common:
- **atmosphere-hybrid-height-coordinate**: Atmosphere
- **atmosphere-hybrid-sigma-pressure-coordinate**: Atmosphere
- **depth**: Ocean
- **land-ice-sigma-coordinate**: Ice sheets

Leave as 'Not applicable' if no vertical grid.

label: Number of Vertical Layers
description: Number of vertical levels.\n\nLeave blank if no vertical grid or varies.

label: Top Layer Thickness (m)
description: Thickness of top layer in metres.\n\nLeave blank if not applicable.

label: Bottom Layer Thickness (m)
description: Thickness of bottom layer in metres.\n\nLeave blank if not applicable.

label: Total Thickness (m)
description: Total vertical extent in metres.\n\nLeave blank if not applicable.

## What Will Be Generated

Based on your selections, the system will auto-create:

1. **horizontal_grid_cells** (ID: g###) - Cell properties
2. **horizontal_subgrids** (IDs: s###, s###) - Based on staggering
3. **horizontal_computational_grid** (ID: c###) - Links subgrids
4. **vertical_computational_grid** (ID: v###) - Vertical structure

**You'll receive:** Horizontal ID (c###) and Vertical ID (v###)

Use these when registering Model Components!
